ðŸ”‘ SSH Setup Instructions - Manual Method

Since automated methods are having issues, here's the manual approach:

STEP 1: Connect to server
ssh ubuntu@100.64.64.33
Password: root

STEP 2: On the server, run these commands one by one:
mkdir -p ~/.ssh
chmod 700 ~/.ssh
cat ~/my_public_key.txt >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
rm ~/my_public_key.txt

STEP 3: Setup Tailscale for background service:
sudo tailscale down
sudo tailscale up --accept-routes --accept-dns=false
sudo systemctl enable tailscaled
sudo systemctl start tailscaled

STEP 4: Test the setup:
exit
ssh ubuntu@100.64.64.33

If step 4 works without asking for password, you're done!

Alternative: Use SSH key directly
ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa ubuntu@100.64.64.33

The public key that was copied to the server:
ssh-rsa  01@DELL01
